p: The fruit of L. formosana (Chinese name LuLuTong) has been used as a traditional Chinese medicine for thousands of years [ 3]; the pharmacology and phytochemistry of L. formosana has been reviewed [ 4]. The fruit extract of L. formosana has shown anti-inflammatory activity [ 5]. The fruits of L. formosana have yielded lupane and oleanane triterpenoids [ 6]. The fruit essential oil has shown antifungal activity and was dominated by α-pinene (16.8%), ( E)-caryophyllene (10.1%), τ-muurolol (8.3%), τ-cadinol (7.6%), β-pinene (6.7%), and sabinene (5.7%) [ 7].
